fontScanner.title: Fonts & Typography
fontScanner.subtitle: Typography Analysis
fontScanner.pageSubtitle: Deep typography analysis with multi-page scanning, font loading performance, and accessibility insights.
fontScanner.multiPageScan: Multi-page scan (analyze fonts across multiple pages)
fontScanner.enhancedAnalysisDesc: Detects font providers (Google Fonts, Adobe Fonts, self-hosted), finds duplicate families, unused weights/styles, missing font-display declarations, and preload opportunities.
fontScanner.dualViewportAnalysis: Dual Viewport Analysis: Fonts analyzed separately for desktop (1920x1080) and mobile (375x667) viewports.
fontScanner.commonFonts: Common fonts used on both viewports

brandConsistency.title: Brand Inspection
brandConsistency.subtitle: Analyze color palette, fonts, and logo usage across your website for brand alignment.
brandConsistency.addLogoTip: Add a logo with alt text containing "logo" for better brand recognition
brandConsistency.faviconPresentDesc: Your site has a favicon for browser tab identification
brandConsistency.faviconMissingDesc: Add a favicon to help users identify your site in browser tabs

excessiveColors.detail: Using {count} colors creates visual chaos. Professional brands use 5-10 colors maximum.
excessiveColors.action: Create a defined color palette with primary, secondary, and accent colors.

tooManyColors.detail: Using {count} colors. Streamline to 8-12 brand colors for better consistency.
tooManyColors.action: Audit your color usage and remove redundant variations.

inconsistentHarmony.detail: Your color palette lacks a clear harmony pattern (complementary, analogous, or triadic).
inconsistentHarmony.action: Use a color wheel to select harmonious colors that work together.

tooManyFonts.detail: Using {count} different fonts creates visual inconsistency and hurts performance.
tooManyFonts.action: Limit to 2-3 font families: one for headings, one for body text, and optionally one for accents.

reduceFontCount.detail: Using {count} fonts. Best practice is 2-3 fonts maximum.
reduceFontCount.action: Review font usage and consolidate where possible.

noTypographyHierarchy.detail: Could not identify distinct heading and body fonts.
noTypographyHierarchy.action: Ensure headings and body text use consistent, distinct font treatments.

noLogo.detail: A logo is essential for brand recognition and trust.
noLogo.action: Add a logo in the header with proper alt text containing "logo".

noFavicon.detail: A favicon helps users identify your site in browser tabs and bookmarks.
noFavicon.action: Add a favicon.ico or use <link rel="icon"> with your brand icon.

inconsistentButtons.detail: Buttons across your site have varying colors and shapes.
inconsistentButtons.action: Define standard button styles in your CSS and use them consistently.

inconsistentLinks.detail: Links use multiple different colors across the page.
inconsistentLinks.action: Set a consistent link color that matches your brand palette.

excellent.detail: Your website maintains strong visual consistency across colors, typography, and branding elements.
excellent.action: Continue maintaining your brand guidelines and conduct periodic audits.

status.notConfigured: Not configured - browsers can connect via HTTP

metaTags.calloutTitle: üè∑Ô∏è Meta Tags are Your First Impression
metaTags.calloutBody: These tags control how your site appears in search results and social media. Optimizing them can increase click-through rates by 30-50%.

bestPractice.title: 50-60 chars, include primary keyword near start
bestPractice.description: 150-160 chars, compelling CTA, unique per page
bestPractice.canonical: Prevents duplicate content, use absolute URLs

images.calloutTitle: I Image SEO: Alt Text is Critical
images.calloutBody: Alt text helps search engines understand images and improves accessibility. Google Image Search drives 20-30% of web traffic for many sites.
images.noImagesFound: No images found on this page

recommendation.fail: Add descriptive alt text for SEO + screen readers

mobile.calloutBody: Google now uses the mobile version of your site for indexing and ranking. Mobile responsiveness is critical for SEO.

security.calloutBody: Google prioritizes secure sites in rankings. Missing security headers can harm SEO and user trust. HTTPS is a direct ranking factor.

details.hstsNotConfigured: Not configured - browsers can connect via HTTP

recommended.https: Required - Always use HTTPS in production

info.title: ‚ìò What is Structured Data Schema?
info.body: Structured data (also called schema markup) is code that helps search engines understand your content better, enabling rich search results like star ratings, product prices, event dates, FAQ dropdowns, and more. It uses the Schema.org vocabulary in JSON-LD, Microdata, or RDFa formats.

ctr.title: U Improved CTR
ctr.body: Rich results stand out and attract more clicks

targeting.title: T Better Targeting
targeting.body: Helps search engines understand your niche

body.afterLink: to ensure your structured data is error-free and eligible for rich snippets. Monitor Search Console for structured data errors.

card.title: No Structured Data Detected
card.body: You're missing enhanced search appearances that boost visibility and click-through rates

starRatings.title: Star Ratings
starRatings.body: Display review stars and ratings directly in search results

productInfo.title: Product Info
productInfo.body: Show prices, availability, and special offers inline

eventDetails.title: Event Details
eventDetails.body: Event dates, locations, and ticket info with calendar integration

richMedia.title: Rich Media
richMedia.body: Enhanced thumbnails, carousels, and video snippets

faq.title: FAQ Dropdowns
faq.body: Expandable Q&A sections directly in search results

proTip.label: ‚ìò Pro Tip:
proTip.body: Rich results can increase click-through rates by 15-35% according to Google research. Start with the foundational schemas below to unlock these benefits.

box.title: Start with these foundational schemas
box.body: that work for almost every website. You can add more specific schemas based on your content type later.

jsonld.body: JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data. Google's preferred format - clean, separate from HTML, easy to maintain.

microdata.subtitle: HTML Attributes
microdata.body: Embedded directly in HTML tags. More complex to maintain but tightly couples markup with content.

rdfa.subtitle: Resource Description
rdfa.body: Resource Description Framework in Attributes. Similar to Microdata, uses different attribute names.

schemaDocs.title: Schema.org Docs
schemaDocs.purpose: Official vocabulary reference with complete documentation for all schema types and properties

richResultsTest.title: Rich Results Test
richResultsTest.purpose: Test your structured data markup and see which Google rich results can be generated from it

validator.title: Schema Validator
validator.purpose: Comprehensive validation tool for all structured data formats including JSON-LD, Microdata, and RDFa

googleGuide.title: Google Guide
googleGuide.purpose: Step-by-step guide from Google on implementing structured data with code examples and best practices

generator.title: Markup Generator
generator.purpose: Free tool to generate JSON-LD structured data markup for various schema types quickly and easily

Organization.benefit: Establishes brand identity in Knowledge Graph

Person.benefit: Powers author rich snippets and Knowledge Panel

Product.benefit: Shows price, availability, and reviews in search

Article.benefit: Enables article snippets with author and publish date

WebSite.benefit: Enables sitelinks search box in Google

BreadcrumbList.benefit: Shows breadcrumb trail in search results

LocalBusiness.benefit: Appears in local search and Google Maps

Event.benefit: Shows event details in search with "Add to Calendar"

Recipe.benefit: Rich recipe cards with ratings, cook time, calories

Review.benefit: Display star ratings directly in search results

VideoObject.benefit: Video snippets with thumbnails and key moments

FAQPage.benefit: Expandable FAQ sections in search results

HowTo.benefit: Numbered steps with images in search

SoftwareApplication.benefit: App install buttons and ratings in search

JobPosting.benefit: Appears in Google for Jobs with salary and location

additional.calloutBody: These technical elements help search engines crawl, index, and understand your site. Missing items can significantly impact discoverability.

bestPractice.sitemap: Submit to Google Search Console, update weekly
bestPractice.favicon: 32x32 PNG or ICO, helps brand recognition
bestPractice.analytics: GA4 recommended, track user behavior for SEO insights

social.calloutBody: While not direct ranking factors, social links increase brand visibility, drive traffic, and improve Open Graph previews when content is shared.
social.heading: Social Media Presence

tip.linkedin: Add to company footer, improves B2B credibility
tip.instagram: Link to business profile, helps visual branding
